intro: Dianthus kajmaktzalanicus, commonly known as the Kajmaktzalan pink, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many ornamental plants known for their showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of pink to reddish flowers with prominent white veins, typical of the genus Dianthus. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
